listing_jobDesc: ZenFocus is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.OpportunityZenFocus’s growth and success is a result of commitment to innovation through entrepreneurial culture and leadership. Employees are driven to make an impact, offer a unique value and most importantly, be part of a winning team. As a successful candidate, you’ll get the chance to work with leading edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects as part of fast-paced, highly collaborative and agile teams. You are an experienced Software Developer who specializes in low code/no code(LCNC) platforms like Salesforce and is excited to learn from talented, fun-loving developers breaking down complex problems into simple solutions. You have the passion for software architecture and design, and enjoy building robust scalable applications in a cross-platform environment. A self-starter who can co-ordinate with a team, yet work independently towards a common goal.Responsibilities: Develop innovative solutions to tackle big industry problemsWrite well designed, scalable, reliable, testable and reusable code by using best software development practices, clean code and solid principlesProvide technical guidance on the research and development of new products and servicesContribute towards the entire development lifecycle of analysis, design, implementation and testDetect, report, investigate, and fix product defectsAutomation, including writing unit and integration testsOptimize and apply best practicesMaintain high standards of quality for code, technical documentation, and deliverablesProvide leadership on implementation of web solutions in SalesforceCollaborate on projects with an all-star team comprised of varying skillsets through code reviews and design discussionsParticipate in brainstorming and idea generation activitiesStay up-to-date with advanced technologies in order to be able to provide the best solutions for new projects_Qualifications: _**Exposure to developing with Salesforce platform. Good understanding of software design patterns.Good understanding of data modelling and storage with well-known relational database (preferably SQL).Demonstrable versatility in multiple front-end and back-end technologies such as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, AngularJS, NodeJS, REST APIs, JSON, WCF, Web API, Unity, LINQ.Experience (or strong interest) in agile methods such as Scrum/XP, Behaviour Driven Development, and Continuous Delivery.Must Haves: Enrolled in a post-secondary program with an accredited College or University in a STEM related program. E INC is the parent company of EBlock and EDealer, unifying our approach to products, services, and strategies under one Vision and one Mission: to create the best digital auction and retailing platform in the world by connecting the automotive wholesale and retail experiences. Our brands and their technologies make it easy for a vehicle to move between buyers and sellers throughout its entire ownership lifecycle. Learn more at https://e.inc/
Are you passionate about web design and UX/UI design? Are you excited to reach a large audience of consumers with your work? We’re looking for someone who strives to captivate audiences with their strong eye for typography, layout, colour, and detail. Our ideal candidate is an organized and detail-oriented professional with a growing passion for web design.

About EDealer:

EDealer is a website and software supplier for the Automotive Industry. Our mission is simple: to help car dealers build great businesses and provide tools for them to manage their leads and inventory. Steadfast in our commitment to creating exceptional learning experiences for our clients, we are a passionate group of integrity-powered leaders who love to learn, grow, and make a difference.
Role Summary:

At EDealer, we are constantly working to provide our clients with the best designs and customer service in the industry. We provide our automotive dealership clients with: website designs, branding, and digital marketing assets. As a Junior Web Designer at EDealer you will work closely with your team lead and alongside a team of other web designers to create stunning mockups of new client websites using combinations of pre-designed template components. This role is fast-paced, with integrated continued learning opportunities and skill development with a strong emphasis on process and detail.

What You Will Do:

Mockup homepage website designs using Adobe XD
Customize the colours, typography and imagery to adhere to dealer brand guidelines.
Develop a thorough understanding of the pre-made templates and components
Collaborate with other designers and the team lead
Translate briefs, objectives and brand guidelines into refreshing design strategies
Adhere to schedules, timelines and deliverables
Continued learning involving skill building video lectures and workshops


What You Will Need:

University or College degree/certificate in graphic/web design or equivalent experience
Portfolio of work showcasing conceptual and execution capabilities for digital mediums. Portfolio must be provided with application.
Proficiency in Adobe Suite, must have experience with Adobe XD and Photoshop.
Great attention to detail
Time management skills and ability to work well under pressure with tight deadlines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
Comfortable working in a team context and an open minded attitude and willingness to learn.
Adaptability and imagination
Ability to accept constructive criticism


E INC is a growing company that is continuing to evaluate our ongoing commitment and investment in our team members with:

Competitive pay
Medical, Dental & Vision
401k/RSP with Match
Company paid Group Life/AD&D insurance
Paid time off
Flexible working environment
Continuous Learning
And an amazing culture to top it all off!


E INC is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. E INC recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other categories protected by law.
E INC is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation. Graph’em Solutions is looking for a local Junior Web Developer to join our team to assist in creating web pages. If you are proactive, a team player, creative, detail-oriented, enjoy learning new things, and are a problem-solver, then this is an excellent opportunity for you to develop in one of the fastest-growing companies in the industry!About Graph’em Solutions Inc.We are a 16+ Web Development company headquartered in Burnaby, BC offering a work-from-home and in-office schedule that promotes productivity, creativity, and wellness. Graph’em Solutions focuses on hiring the most talented web designers and developers, like yourself, by providing a supportive, innovative, flexible, safe, and responsible work environment. Understanding that your skills are extremely valuable, we ensure an environment where you can do the work you are passionate about, and provide flexibility within your role, all while investing in your personal and professional development so that you can achieve your greatest potential. We have big plans to grow, and we would like you to be a part of that expansion.*Graph’em’s Core Values: *TrustworthinessResponsivenessFair ExchangeCommunicationIntegrity*Graph’em’s Products & Services*At Graph’em, we always take on the customer’s viewpoint. That's why the foundation of our work is based on a 100% understanding of our client’s company and vision. Here are the products and services we offer:Fully functional, aesthetic, and professional Business Websites and/or E-Commerce stores using the latest/future technologyFast and professional on-demand web development and web design services to resolve our customer’s challenges with their websites or Shopify E-Commerce storesProfessional web development services to develop and maintain bug-free, user-friendly, and easy to update complex web applications (software)Job DescriptionAs a Junior Web Developer at Graph’em, you will be building web pages using different programming languages and creating landing pages from Photoshop designs.The ideal candidate must display excellent written and oral skills with demonstrated interpersonal and organizational abilities, and must be able to work in a varied, fast-paced environment that is advancing every day. The ability to self-manage and work independently is also important.*Your Responsibilities: *Build web pages using HTML5 and CSS3Build web pages using the WordPress CMSCreate Landing Pages from Photoshop designsBuild web pages using themesAbout You - Skills and Qualifications Required: Great knowledge in HTTML5, CSS3, JavascriptOrganized, responsible, and great time management skillsUnderstanding of design specificationsAbility to take designs from PSD format and produce an accurate duplication on the final web pageBuilding web pages using a visual builder such as DiviExperience with WooCommerce and/or Shopify is a plusWilling to learn industry best practices and grow professionallyAbility to learn quickly and adapt to new technologiesBenefits:Health Spending Account*Physical Wellness Program (including healthy food in-office, discounts at Goodlife Gym and a health food store, wellness spending allowance, challenges and prizes, and much more)*Paid Time OffRRSP/TFSA match (up to 4% of salary)*Regular Lunch and LearnsFun Company Events and CompetitionsWork From Home Option (Requirement to be in the office minimum 2 days per week)Fully Setup OfficeCareer Growth (i.e. you can suggest what you want to receive training on and we make that happen)A monthly game at lunchAvailable after probation period of 3 months*Salary*$40,000-$50,000 CAD yearly based on experienceGraph’em is Mindful of Physical WellnessPhysical wellness is something we value at Graph’em as it is positively related to numerous benefits:Higher levels of concentrationIncreased mental abilityReduced levels of stressImproved learning abilitySharper memoryImproved levels of focus and creativityStrengthened immune systemAll of these translate into a happier, healthier, saner, and more productive working environment. That is why we offer our employees a very comprehensive Wellness program to encourage and support physical health.*Graph’em is Involved in the Community*We believe that physical health awareness should start early in life. This is why Graph’em is involved in its community, among other things, by supporting Drug-Free Dash, which raises funds to support community programs like KidSport and The Boys & Girls Club. They provide the means for organized sports and after-school activities to help promote an active, healthy lifestyle which helps keep youth-focused and active. Proceeds also benefit drug education materials for youth groups, law enforcement and educators – Informed Youth are Drug-Free Youth.Why Work With Us at Graph’em?You get to join a happy, highly-skilled and dedicated team that is very supportive and easy to communicate with - check out our great reviews on Glassdoor: https://www.glassdoor.ca/Reviews/Graphem-Solutions-Reviews-E1927340.htmYou have the ability to work on many different types of projectsYou are introduced to the newest and different types of programming languagesWe provide high flexibility (to be worked out with your senior)You would be joining a positive environment that promotes respect, wellness, and camaraderieOur leadership walks the talk, is highly knowledgeable and skilled, kind, and very fun and easy to work withWe are located in an accessible location, near transit, and other businesses such as the mall and great restaurantsWe provide an abundance of learning about things you truly care about and want/need to knowEvery Graph’em team member brings something unique to the team.We want to hear your story. What we’re aboutRelish is a company of thinkers, creatives, makers, educators, and entrepreneurs. We believe that using business as a force for good is good for business. So, we strive to empower people and organizations to create positive change through design, technology and innovation.Where we can, we help businesses become responsive to customers, who increasingly desire more meaningful connections with brands and products. In this way, we can produce a positive social impact.As a Certified B-Corporation, we strive to improve by assessing our practices and policies annually as they relate to our environment, our employees, our customers, our community, and governance.We’re looking for a Web DeveloperIf you have a degree or diploma in web development or programming, and have a solid understanding of WordPress and theme development, then a career at Relish is right up your alley.Responsibilities Website Project Management skills requiredExperience working directly with clientsWordPress theme development experience is required.Proficient in HTML5 , CSS and JavaScriptStrong knowledge of Responsive Development and Mobile First approach to theme developmentIn-depth PHP knowledge is requiredA conceptual thinker who can develop big ideasDetail-oriented, even under tight time constraintsCollaborative, open-minded and comfortable participating in critiquesSelf-motivated to continuously learn and try new thingsA great listener who can solve problems for specific people with designExperience2-4 years in a similar positionWebsite Project Management ExperienceUnderstanding of relational databases, web hosting services, domain management knowledge, an assetCMS development experience (in addition to WordPress)Web application development experience is an assetPlease apply with your resume and a digital portfolio with relevant work samples to James Black.Relish is committed to creating a diverse environment and strives to create and maintain a workplace that is inclusive, equitable and welcoming. We honour unique experiences, perspectives and identities.We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age. Our company is hiring a Web Developer to maintain our website and keep it up to date, compatible with different browsers and devices, and working effectively. You will be involved in the entire process, from planning to design, and maintenance. Web Developer responsibilities include interpreting requirements and proposing solutions, implementing technical designs, testing functionality, and promoting site updates. As an ideal candidate, you should enjoy working on the Internet and have a great deal of knowledge about web technologies like HTML5. Additionally, you should be technically motivated and able to lead a team of developers. Your goal is to create new functionalities for our website while improving its speed and accessibility.Responsibilities:Design, code, and maintain websites and web applications.Research and select programming languages and tools to meet the specific functional requirements of project.Evaluate feasibility of a project idea by determining key objectives, as well as resources, time and budget available.Provide technical expertise in writing complex applications using computer software.Process requests from all other team members including, but not limited to programmers, business analysts and testers.Write technical specifications and user documentation for the application.Write test plans and test scripts to ensure that all features are tested properly before going live.Identify issues with coding by debugging the application during development phase.Report the status of the project to stakeholders (e.g. managers, clients etc.).Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePart-time hours: 20 per weekSalary: $49,300.00-$57,893.00 per yearBenefits:Dental carePaid time offSchedule:8 hour shift Our company is hiring a Web Developer to maintain our website and keep it up to date, compatible with different browsers and devices, and working effectively. Position: Web Developer Co-op/Intern
Duration: 3 months+
Date: Winter Jan 3 - April 28, 2023
Location:Hybrid, Onsite, Virtual, (Flexible)

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

The team you'll be part of

Network Infrastructure

The pandemic has highlighted how important telecoms networks are to society. Nokia’s Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to bring more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise.
Education Recommendations

Currently a candidate for Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields with an accredited university in Canada


What you will learn and contribute to

As part of our team, you will:
Work on Network Services Platform (NSP) Product: https://www.nokia.com/networks/products/network-services-platform/
Assist in designing and implementing web GUI features – built with React and Redux
Be expose and learn cutting edge network technologies in the fields of SDN
Interacting with User Experience experts to deliver modern, easy to use enterprise-grade applications
Interact with Support Teams to provide software solutions to field-reported issues.
Be part of design team delivering customer features
Work in a team-based Agile Environment; collaborate with Developers, Testers, and Product Management to refine requirements, develop, and test our products.
What is Nokia looking for from me

You have:
Proficiency in JavaScript, React, HTML5, CSS3
Experience in application state management eg: Redux

It would be nice if you also had:
Familiarity with react component libraries such as ag-grid, formik, styled-components
Experience working with package managers like npm
Strong understanding of REST API
Experience with Git
Why we're awesome

Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
Company Culture: We believe our people are our greatest asset and we aim to foster a fun, challenging, positive, and inclusive work environment. We offer 1-on-1 mentorship, learning and development opportunities, global impact and interaction, and flexible work/life balance
Meaningful Co-op Term: During your co-op term, you will have the opportunity to test out the latest technologies and work on innovative projects that could leave a global impact. You get to use skills learned in the classroom and apply it to real work situations while gaining professional hands-on experience.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.

Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

See you this Winter 2023!!

“My experience at Nokia has been amazing, one of the best learning experiences I ever had in my life. As Co-op student, it was an honor to be treated as any other full-time employee at Nokia. I got the freedom to design & implement my ideas. Working at Nokia as a Co-op student was the best thing that ever happened, it was a life changing opportunity.” – Ummar Tantray, Former Nokia Co-op student, Fall 2020

Our team is expanding and looking for smart, technical and eager interns to mentor and develop. As a Software Developer Co-op, you will have a blend of responsibilities that will require a hands-on approach and result in being a key contributor to the production of software. This is an exciting opportunity for emerging talents to join the changing landscape of the mortgage industry. You are joining one of Canada’s leading providers of institutional mortgage software and will be supported by our team of seasoned and talented developers.
Role and Responsibilities:
Work with internal stakeholders on development strategy and execution plans while meeting the functional requirements of the business
Deliver a solid technical solution with consideration to security, performance, usability, testability, reliability and scalability of the application
Use effective communication skills to ensure projects and expectations are delivered successfully
Ensure code is delivered in a timely manner and any issues are proactively communicated to the Development Manager and
Work with one or many of the following technologies: C#, .NET, SQL/NoSQL databases, ReactJS, Node, HTML/CSS.
Skills and Qualifications:
In the process of completing a university degree, preferably in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience with a strong grasp in object-oriented programming
Demonstrated proficiency with full-stack web application development through personal projects, work experience, or schoolwork
Familiarity and experience with the technologies we work with considered an asset
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
A passion to learn and build your technical skills
Desire to gain work experience and build a foundation with a growing company
Work well within a team and also independently
About Us
Welcome to Intellifi, where our mission is “Lending Solutions Simplified”. This is more than tagline for us – it’s our commitment to every customer, business partner and team member.
While we have decades worth of experience and expertise in Commercial Services and Technology, Residential Services, and Residential Technology, we aren’t standing still. From the adventurous start ups to the established institutions with billions in assets, and to those we have yet to serve, we owe it to our dozens of clients to always be moving forward.
At Intellifi we believe that a culture of innovation, creativity and partnership is what enable us to provide executable end-to-end solutions to the various lenders in the residential and commercial industry in Canada. Where hi-tech meets hi-touch, we are a team of experts providing a selection of technology products and lending operations services that helps create efficiency in loan management for both our clients and their customers.
Equal Opportunity Employer
Intellifi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process by emailing HR@intellifi.ca.
We want to hear from you!
If you are confident that you would be a strong asset to our team, submit both a cover letter and resume today! We thank all applicants for their time in applying, however we will only contact those selected for an interview. Consideration of applications will begin immediately and continue until the position is filled. Our team is expanding and looking for smart, technical and eager interns to mentor and develop. As a Software Developer Co-op, you will have a blend of responsibilities that will require a hands-on approach and result in being a key contributor to the production of software. This is an exciting opportunity for emerging talents to join the changing landscape of the mortgage industry. You are joining one of Canada’s leading providers of institutional mortgage software and will be supported by our team of seasoned and talented developers.

Deliver a solid technical solution with consideration to security, performance, usability, testability, reliability and scalability of the application
Use effective communication skills to ensure projects and expectations are delivered successfully
Ensure code is delivered in a timely manner and any issues are proactively communicated to the Development Manager and
Work with one or many of the following technologies: C#, .NET, SQL/NoSQL databases, ReactJS, Node, HTML/CSS.
Skills and Qualifications:

Demonstrated proficiency with full-stack web application development through personal projects, work experience, or schoolwork

Join the EOS Nation team!EOS Nation builds solutions to maximize collaboration and independence for all humanity. We've been experimenting with the EOSIO blockchain community since 2018 and have developed unique Web3 skills and insights along with a robust portfolio of products, services, and infrastructure to propel us on this mission.Pomelo creates opportunities for individuals and teams to get funded by the community to build the public goods they care about. Through the magic of quadratic funding, our Web3 crowdfunding platform is on track to raise more than $2M for meaningful work that benefits the entire ecosystem – and we’re just getting started!We’re operators of the EOS, WAX, Ultra, UX, ORE, and BBS blockchains. We’re proud to be trusted delegates of some of the world’s largest DAOs and recognized leaders in high-performance and high-uptime bare metal infrastructure operations.We’re building Solutions to make the world’s open data accessible across blockchain protocols and communities. We operate independent data centers and participate with a community of global operators to ensure the critical data that makes Web3 experiences possible is available everywhere at all times.Your mission in our team…Put your front end developer skills to work. Join our team and help us build innovative Web3 solutions that touch the lives of our community members.You'll collaborate directly with EOS Nation's experienced team of blockchain engineers, product managers, and designers to deliver a great experience to users on the cutting edge of open data and decentralized finance.Work from anywhere in Canada and earn $65-85k CAD per year according to experience.Responsibilities: Develop and improve user interfaces for EOS Nation's new and existing blockchain web applications, such as Pomelo.io, EOS Name Service, EOS Detective, our decentralized financial instruments, and other secret projects we've yet to announce.Leverage open data sources to enrich the experience.Participate in the design process and help shape the product architecture.Qualifications: Must be strong in Vue.js and Typescript.Strong english communication skills written and verbal.Excellent customer service skills in person, over the phone and via email.Strong multitasking, troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills.Good time management skills, the ability to work independently.Experience integrating UIs with EOS or other blockchains are an asset, but not required.Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science is preferred, but not required.In return, we promise to give you: Insurance: Life Insurance,Dental Care,Long Term Disability,Extended Health Care (Drug plan, Vision, Healthcare Practitioners),Health Care Spending Account,Work-life balance: Employee Assistance Program,Unlimited Vacation Policy,Lifestyle Spending Account,Flexible Schedule,Choose between Remote Work or joining us at our offices in Gatineau or SherbrookeIn addition, we also provide an Office Expense Spending Account, Virtual Health (Akira) and a competitive salary!You want to be part of something bigger than yourself?To have a meaningful job that maximizes collaboration and independence?Send your resume to our HR team! We’re always on the lookout for talented developers to join our team. Think you’d make a valuable addition? Let us know what sets you apart and we’ll get in touch! This is a full-time position that is open to local (Kelowna, B.C.) candidates, as well we offer hybrid and remote work options for those who prefer it.
If you want to work with an exceptional group of people, with numerous benefits, like the chance to work remotely, and a terrific corporate culture—you are on the right page.
Acro Media is looking for a Software Developer to develop Commerce builds. Someone who can code like it’s their native tongue but still talk to our crew comfortably and sometimes even the odd client.
We consider ourselves a laid-back bunch but driven to do well for our customers. We’re looking for low egos and high skills. You can be young and inexperienced or a savvy veteran, what we’re really looking for is your ability to code, which may be finely honed skill or raw talent at this point.
We aren't looking to stick you in a corner with headphones on and call you “the IT department”. Developers own this joint; we get it. If you’re desperate to break free from that office life where you co-workers have never even heard of Minecraft, and want to come on board to build kick-ass commerce sites, corporate gems, and the occasional game, keep reading.
As the successful candidate, here are some things you’ll be responsible for:

Producing high quality work adhering to Acro Media standards and following the Acro Media production process
Implementing updates & revisions to web sites
Contributing code back to the Drupal community, testing and responding to issues, maintaining modules.
Working independently on multiple smaller tasks or larger builds with shifting priorities and tight deadlines
Adhering to and providing accurate estimates for the amount of time required to repair a defect, a build, or to add additional functionality to an existing application
Providing efficient solutions in a timely manner for work requests, issues, and defects
Communicating well with Account Managers, Supervisors, and Clients in regards to work requests, problems and defects
Acting as both a peer/mentor to other Developers as well as be comfortable asking for help from team members


The successful applicant will have:

Ability to find and fix problems in code, this might not be your code and your only hint might be a cryptic complaint from a client.
A good mix of web development skills, you should be able to build out site template and then code all the gears and pulleys behind the scenes as well, we try not to have people who do all HTML/CSS and people who do all backend coding, we like people who can multi-class. You’re not going to work on the same thing for 8 months. If you only have experience on embedded systems or just design sexy layouts, maybe try to brush up on your weaker areas, we are open minded though so don’t let this scare you away.
Our designers use Photoshop, so when you’re building out the templates, it’s good to know how to navigate around this application. Basic knowledge of how layers work, and the use of some the more important tools that are required for taking apart the design and deriving all the images for web-use is a plus.
We're open to good programmers who know other languages and technologies and are will to learn, but below is a list of a bunch of stuff we normally work with:
PHP
SQL
CSS3/HTML5
Javascript/jQuery
XML
Bonus: C++/Objective C/C#/C
If you know other languages don’t forget to mention them, if you are a badass Lisp hacker type, mention that.
Comfortable working in a Linux shell to do day-to-day tasks. Hopefully, you have installed Linux on something at least once, even if it was just your Xbox, phone...or vacuum etc. (For real though, you can get Linux installed on a Roomba)
Some understanding of Linux hosting if at all possible. Have you configured your own server? Did you setup a web server for your house or friends, even if no one else really cared?
Prior experience with a source control system (ex, SVN, Git, GitHub, etc.)
Has some coding work to send us
Formal education or prior experience is NOT required, we just want to know that you can code, so you’ll have to have some work you can show us.
Fluency in English
An excellent internet connection is required; you must be able to sustain an hour long conference call without any issues
All offers of employment with Acro Media Inc are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check.


Here are some things we pride ourselves on being able to offer our staff:

Flex start times & Earned days off: Do you prefer to start at 8:00? or 9:00? We'll work with you. Want every second Friday off? Well we've got a program for that too!
Paid Overtime for all roles...including salary positions: What? What?! Yep you heard right. We pay for all approved OT...not that we want everyone working so hard, but with the natural ebb and flow of our industry sometimes it's needed to blast out the OT in order to keep our heads above water. We find this little pay cheque nugget is a nice reward for the over timerz.
Slappies: Tougher to explain but once a month we get together and have a little ceremony, some food, a few brews - no altars or corporate chants involved.
Fun day: We aim to have fun every day; however, every year for a day we cram a bunch of fun on ourselves. Weee!
SPARC Events: Sometimes we have an in-house breakfast, team building events, (less corny than it sounds), competitions, or just a plain little reward for no reason. It's a little spark in our usually normal days. Warning, we make you wear costumes. Often.
Culture: We're a certain type of people. We're all a little different and unique in our own way but we seem to work well together. No one’s perfect and we embrace that. We take our work seriously, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. Check out our site to get to know us!

DCM Inc. is looking for a UX Developer to work as part of a team to develop frontend components for new and existing applications that interface with server side components created by other team members.ResponsibilitiesCoordinate development schedules with other team members in weekly meetingsDevelop components and submit to repositories for further reviewDevelop unit tests and participate in function & quality assurance testing proceduresEngage in review meetings with senior team membersQualificationsProficiency with fundamental web development technologies such as HTML, CSS and JavascriptKnowledge of design fundamentals and principles of Material DesignExperience with React or similar frontend frameworks such as Angular or NextJSExperience with ReduxExperience with Figma or similar UI design programsAt DCM Inc., we’re always looking for driven, humble and passionate team members!Our Culture – the sum of our people: At DCM Inc., we embrace and actively cultivate the following values: We Audit: No concerns about status and ego and willing to do whatever is needed to make the company succeed. No job is beneath any team member. Set status and ego aside to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty. We live by this value and expect our team to as well.Teamwork is our foundation: We practice what we preach and have a deep understanding and appreciation for how important strong team foundations like psychological safety, mutual trust, clarity, and strong communication are. We work hard to provide the space and opportunities needed to foster strong team environments.We Own it: We believe that anyone can be an owner and everyone at DCM Inc. must be an owner. A DCM Inc. owner is someone who: is willing to set a hard goal that they don’t necessarily know how to meet, will work to achieve that outcome despite inevitable obstacles, will solve the underlying problem vs. ticking a box to complete a task, asks for feedback and thought partnership, and communicates key learnings and their process throughout.We Debate to great: We want the best ideas, ambitious goals, and decisions. Almost no idea or goal is the best in its original form. We believe collective problem solving, debate and conflict sharpen ideas, ambitions, and decisions into better versions, and can help everyone improve.We Learn & learn some more: We seek the shortest path to get to better outcomes. This means that we operate with pace and a focus on learning quickly so that we optimize our learning, in service of getting to the right answer in the least amount of time.We Push our potential: We want everyone to be at the edge of their personal learning zone and we believe that most people have more learning capabilities than they know. Job DescriptionPosition: Junior Software Developer**Who we are: IRD is an Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) company and a world leader in the highway traffic management and in-vehicle systems solutions industry, specializing in traffic data collection, weight enforcement, commercial vehicle operations, toll, and safety. Over the past 40 years, IRD has diversified both from a market and geographical perspective. IRD Systems are designed and built by a multidisciplinary, customer-focused team which fuses core IRD technology with integrated computing and communications technologies.IRD is currently looking to add a Junior Software Developer to our team.As part of a team of software developers, you will participate in the design of modules and applications as well as be responsible for development and maintenance of software modules and applications with an emphasis on secure coding practices. The software modules will range from real time applications to web-based applications running on the edge or in the cloud.Our team is expanding to accommodate our growing workload and our complex projects.*Key Responsibilities: **Participate in system-level and software designsPrepare documentation to support design reviewsCreate system software from existing base software packages based on approved software designs including appropriate scripts, make files, configuration files, etc.Investigate and propose alternatives for implementing new designs and improving processesModify existing software modules, code new software modules, participate in code reviews.Follow software development workflowsCode management and build processes using tools such as GIT*Qualifications (education, experience, skillsets): **Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent0-3 years' experience supporting web-based applications and development*Experience with the following: **Microsoft Windows, Linux or similarWeb applications, web services, databases (Oracle or PostgreSQL), graphical user interfaces, real-time programming, object-oriented programming, control systems, data analysis, networks, mappingProgramming languages such as: C, C#, Java, SQL, PHP, JavaScript, Python, HTMLEclipse, Visual Studio Code, IntelliJAgile development is considered an assetSecure coding practicesTCP/IP, UDP, SSL, sockets and general networking architecturesAuthentication frameworks such as SAML, OpenID, OAuthWeb applications, web servers, databases and graphical user interfaces is an assetInter-procedural and inter-networking techniques, tools and protocolsKnowledge of OWASP top 10 and CWE top 25*Competencies: **Works well in a team environmentEffective communicator (written and verbal)Ability to prioritize between project and support / maintenance requirementsAgile learner*If you'd like to learn more and apply - please click on the "I'm interested" button and apply!*Job InformationIndustryTransportationWork Experience0-1 yearCitySaskatoon North CentralState/ProvinceSaskatchewanCountryCanadaZip/Postal CodeS7KJob Type: Full-time Job DescriptionPosition: Junior Software Developer**Who we are: IRD is an Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) company and a world leader in the highway traffic management and in-vehicle systems solutions industry, specializing in traffic data collection, weight enforcement, commercial vehicle operations, toll, and safety. Over the past 40 years, IRD has diversified both from a market and geographical perspective. IRD Systems are designed and built by a multidisciplinary, customer-focused team which fuses core IRD technology with integrated computing and communications technologies.IRD is currently looking to add a Junior Software Developer to our team.As part of a team of software developers, you will participate in the design of modules and applications as well as be responsible for development and maintenance of software modules and applications with an emphasis on secure coding practices. The software modules will range from real time applications to web-based applications running on the edge or in the cloud.Our team is expanding to accommodate our growing workload and our complex projects.*Key Responsibilities: **Participate in system-level and software designsPrepare documentation to support design reviewsCreate system software from existing base software packages based on approved software designs including appropriate scripts, make files, configuration files, etc.Investigate and propose alternatives for implementing new designs and improving processesModify existing software modules, code new software modules, participate in code reviews.Follow software development workflowsCode management and build processes using tools such as GIT*Qualifications (education, experience, skillsets): **Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent0-3 years' experience supporting web-based applications and development*Experience with the following: **Microsoft Windows, Linux or similarWeb applications, web services, databases (Oracle or PostgreSQL), graphical user interfaces, real-time programming, object-oriented programming, control systems, data analysis, networks, mappingProgramming languages such as: C, C#, Java, SQL, PHP, JavaScript, Python, HTMLEclipse, Visual Studio Code, IntelliJAgile development is considered an assetSecure coding practicesTCP/IP, UDP, SSL, sockets and general networking architecturesAuthentication frameworks such as SAML, OpenID, OAuthWeb applications, web servers, databases and graphical user interfaces is an assetInter-procedural and inter-networking techniques, tools and protocolsKnowledge of OWASP top 10 and CWE top 25*Competencies: **Works well in a team environmentEffective communicator (written and verbal)Ability to prioritize between project and support / maintenance requirementsAgile learner*If you'd like to learn more and apply - please click on the "I'm interested" button and apply!*Job InformationIndustryTransportationWork Experience0-1 yearCitySaskatoon North CentralState/ProvinceSaskatchewanCountryCanadaZip/Postal CodeS7KJob Type: Full-time Show more

Position & Requirements OverviewWe are seeking a dedicated, well-rounded HTML developer to join our growing company. You will collaborate with designers to create effective and eye-catching website layouts based on design template files and wireframes provided by developers. As an HTML developer, you will be expected to create responsive web designs that match templates for a range of standard screen resolutions. Your duties will include creating HTML and CSS files that can be passed to web developers to create working sites and applications.Position Responsibilities· Create high-quality HTML files based on the latest HTML5 and W3C standards· Use CSS (and CSS preprocessors, such as Less and Sass) to create web applications and app layouts that match designer visions at a range of screen resolutions· Use ARIA and other HTML attributes to create websites that support accessibility options· Use W3C Markup Validation Service and CSS Validation Service to ensure all layouts comply with W3C standardsJob Qualifications & Required Skill SetsPlease note applicants who do not meet the required skill sets portion of this job description will not be considered for this position.Advanced working experience with ExpressionEngine, Webflow, HTML5, and CSS3 mandatoryDemonstrated proficiency in PHP, JavaScript, Bootstrap, jQuery, web APIs, and other front-end development technologiesAdvanced experience with wireframing & prototyping tools (Figma, Sketch, InVision)Demonstrated experience in using a variety of CSS tools & frameworks, including Bootstrap and Semantic UI; familiarity with processors (Sass and Less)3+ years of html development experience & portfolio of workMust be: An autonomous self-starterCreative, strategic, and independent thinkingOrganized and detail-orientedEnthusiastic for self-learning & continued technical growthPreferred Additional QualificationsBachelor's degree in related fieldExperience with Shopify, Wordpress, and Craft CMSLiquid Template Language, AJAX, and SQLTesting and Test Driven Development (TDD)Familiarity with MySQL and cron jobsAdditional programming languages a Plus ie: Ruby, AngularJS, PythonUnderstanding of information architecture, UI/UX, and SEOPrevious employment with a creative agencyAbout SignatureWEBSignatureWEB is a fast-growing agency looking for talented and enthusiastic people who share our excitement for building a better world for companies with an online presence. who is driven to learn, accept challenges, and craft effective solutions as part of our talented creative team. This role is a key part of our future success and will help the vision we have for our clients’ online needs.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: From $40,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressPaid time offWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:Expression Engine: 1 year (preferred) Position & Requirements OverviewWe are seeking a dedicated, well-rounded HTML developer to join our growing company. job_title: Co-op Fall 2022: IT and Web Developer
listing_jobDesc: Fall 2022 Co-Op: IT and Web DeveloperJob Type: Co-op (Full-time/Part-time)Co-op Start Date: Fall 2022, September 1st*There will be One (1) Pre-position training 2-4 weeks before starting date**Recruited members will be working remotely from home, and we welcome international applicants. FANIQUE is seeking an IT and Web developer (Co-op Summer 2022) who loves to work in Fashion, Lifestyle, and Technology sectors. If you look forward to growing within a fast-paced startup environment, love to learn what's connecting brands with customers, and are constantly eager to improve your professional work skills, please read on.About YouA passionate and hardworking learner who likes to grow with the company and has the potential to take on additional roles and responsibilities as the business grows. You are proud of your work and being part of a team. You love solving problems and taking on challenges.About FANIQUEFANIQUE Group - www.faniquegroup.comFANIQUE is an innovative incubator for business in LIFESTYLE, TECH, and FASHION. The unique business model of FANIQUE creates a sustainably circular system to help innovations to grow that includes three divisions of a publication platform FANIQUE.com (aka. FANIQUE Magazine), an e-commerce platform F Store, and a concept space/hotel business, F Space. We aim to inspire global audiences and unite industry professionals worldwide.F Store: www.fstore.worldF Space: www.fspace.worldFANIQUE Magazine: www.fanique.comWhat You Will DoResponsibilities include, but are not limited to:Assisting the web development team with all aspects of website and application design.Assisting with the testing and maintenance of backend and front-end applications.Brainstorming new tech applications such as digital storage and mobile technology.Collaborating with developers to implement new web features.Keeping up to date with the latest technology and programming trends.Converting video, audio, written, and graphic components into compatible formats for the web.Using user feedback to identify and correct problems with a client's website.What Skills you haveA Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, or a similar field.Experience working with coding languages such as HTML, Python JQuery, JSON, and Ajax.Solid understanding of web design and development principles.Good planning, analytical, and decision-making skills.A portfolio of web design and projects you have worked on.Critical-thinking skills.Flexibility in the workplace.In-depth knowledge of software prototyping and UX design tools.Goal-orientated and deadline-driven.Contract length: 4 monthsPart-time hours: 20 hours per week (Minimum); 3 days per week (Minimum)Expected start date: 2022-09-01Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 monthsPart-time hours: 20 per weekSchedule:8 hour shiftExpected start date: 2022-09-01 Fall 2022 Co-Op: IT and Web DeveloperJob Type: Co-op (Full-time/Part-time)Co-op Start Date: Fall 2022, September 1st*There will be One (1) Pre-position training 2-4 weeks before starting date**Recruited members will be working remotely from home, and we welcome international applicants. companyName: Girl Guides of Canada-Guides du Canada
listing_jobDesc: Web Developer (14-Month Contract) Girl Guides of Canada–Guides du Canada (GGC), a national membership-based organization, empowers every girl in Guiding to discover herself and be everything she wants to be. Our mission is to be a catalyst for girls empowering girls. Together, we’re building our vision of A better world, by girls. GGC is actively searching for a Web Developer – 14-month contract *Hybrid/Remote work arrangement As the Web Developer, you will lead the creation and posting of web content that optimizes web design and user experience requirements, ensuring web content tells a compelling story about GGC to parents, members, volunteers, donors and the public, while providing essential information about the organization.You’ll also provide website maintenance, technical guidance and oversight for website projects while collaborating with cross-functional teams across the organization. This role is filling a maternity leave.The Web Developer will:Translate client’s goals into inclusive & creative web content, with a focus on a seamless user experience.Bring an inclusive user-experience lens to all work, ensuring web content aligns with the needs of those coming to girlguides.ca.Ensure all web content is consistent with user experience best practices, brand standards and web accessibility compliance standards like Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities (AODA) and WebContent Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG).Provide website technical guidance and leadership to other departments as needed.Provide project updates and statuses to client departments and senior leadership.Coordinate with media agencies to optimize web applications for digital marketing e.g., GoogleMarketing Tools.Analyze new applications and upgrades/enhancements and provide recommendations.Work with internal clients to translate their information and communication needs into engaging web content.Apply organizational policies regarding inclusivity to content, member communication and customer service.You are the model candidate if you have: Experience creating web content for youth and parent audiences – with a focus on attracting new members/audiences through web content focused on a compelling user experience.Experience with project management across the full project lifecycle working with various cross- functional teams.A post-secondary education in Computer Science, Web Development, Information Technology, or a related discipline.3+ years of hands-on Web Development experience.Intermediate knowledge of best practices and standards for web development like User ExperienceDesign (UX/UI), Web Application Security, AODA, cross-browser compatibility, mobile-first and responsive design.Intermediate-expert knowledge in web application development, programming and front-end technologies i.e., HTML/CSS/JavaScript; basic knowledge of back-end technologies i.e., C#, PHP,Node.JS, Angular, ASP.Net.Experience with Google Analytics, Google Maps, Tag Manager, AdWords and Search Console,SERP ranking and overall data analytics on the user journey.Proven productivity and collaboration computer skills including Microsoft O365 (Word, Excel,PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint Online, Teams and Planner), and online forms.Ability to work well within a team environment, including collaborating with client departments, designers, copywriters, social media coordinator, and other staff.Ability to identify and learn new skills to improve efficiencies.Web Developer (14-Month Contract) Excellent presentation, facilitation and communication skills.Strong research, analytical, problem-solving and troubleshooting capabilities.Effective decision-making and negotiation skills.Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate and work well with others as well as independently with a customer service focus.ASSETS Experience with web accessibility testing tools e.g., WAVE, AChecker and WCAG 2.0 guidelines.Experience working with Drupal, WordPress.Experience with at least one .NET CMS platformSkills in Visual Studio and PhotoShopFormal training in User Experience.Working experience with a non-profit organization.Familiarity with basic usability testing and QA processes.Experience with iMIS RiSE.Starting Salary:  *$55,231 annually*Salary based on location, Greater Toronto AreaDoes this sound like you? Then apply today! Send your cover letter and resume (as one file) to - HR@ girlguides.ca (remove spaces).This position will remain open until filled. Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis. Kindly reference the position title in the subject line of your email message Submissions without a cover letter will not be considered. GGC is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. We value a recruitment and selection process that is inclusive and barrier-free, and we encourage applications from people who are racialized,Indigenous, people from the 2SLGBTQI+ community, people with disabilities and other equity seeking groups.Upon request, GGC will make available reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities during the recruitment process. Accommodation requests should be made in advance to People & Culture at HR@ girlguides.ca (remove spaces).We thank all candidates for their interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 14 monthsSalary: From $55,231.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shift Web Developer (14-Month Contract) Girl Guides of Canada–Guides du Canada (GGC), a national membership-based organization, empowers every girl in Guiding to discover herself and be everything she wants to be. Our mission is to be a catalyst for girls empowering girls. Together, we’re building our vision of A better world, by girls. GGC is actively searching for a Web Developer – 14-month contract *Hybrid/Remote work arrangement As the Web Developer, you will lead the creation and posting of web content that optimizes web design and user experience requirements, ensuring web content tells a compelling story about GGC to parents, members, volunteers, donors and the public, while providing essential information about the organization.You’ll also provide website maintenance, technical guidance and oversight for website projects while collaborating with cross-functional teams across the organization. This role is filling a maternity leave.The Web Developer will:Translate client’s goals into inclusive & creative web content, with a focus on a seamless user experience.Bring an inclusive user-experience lens to all work, ensuring web content aligns with the needs of those coming to girlguides.ca.Ensure all web content is consistent with user experience best practices, brand standards and web accessibility compliance standards like Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities (AODA) and WebContent Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG).Provide website technical guidance and leadership to other departments as needed.Provide project updates and statuses to client departments and senior leadership.Coordinate with media agencies to optimize web applications for digital marketing e.g., GoogleMarketing Tools.Analyze new applications and upgrades/enhancements and provide recommendations.Work with internal clients to translate their information and communication needs into engaging web content.Apply organizational policies regarding inclusivity to content, member communication and customer service.You are the model candidate if you have: Experience creating web content for youth and parent audiences – with a focus on attracting new members/audiences through web content focused on a compelling user experience.Experience with project management across the full project lifecycle working with various cross- functional teams.A post-secondary education in Computer Science, Web Development, Information Technology, or a related discipline.3+ years of hands-on Web Development experience.Intermediate knowledge of best practices and standards for web development like User ExperienceDesign (UX/UI), Web Application Security, AODA, cross-browser compatibility, mobile-first and responsive design.Intermediate-expert knowledge in web application development, programming and front-end technologies i.e., HTML/CSS/JavaScript; basic knowledge of back-end technologies i.e., C#, PHP,Node.JS, Angular, ASP.Net.Experience with Google Analytics, Google Maps, Tag Manager, AdWords and Search Console,SERP ranking and overall data analytics on the user journey.Proven productivity and collaboration computer skills including Microsoft O365 (Word, Excel,PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint Online, Teams and Planner), and online forms.Ability to work well within a team environment, including collaborating with client departments, designers, copywriters, social media coordinator, and other staff.Ability to identify and learn new skills to improve efficiencies.Web Developer (14-Month Contract) Excellent presentation, facilitation and communication skills.Strong research, analytical, problem-solving and troubleshooting capabilities.Effective decision-making and negotiation skills.Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate and work well with others as well as independently with a customer service focus.ASSETS Experience with web accessibility testing tools e.g., WAVE, AChecker and WCAG 2.0 guidelines.Experience working with Drupal, WordPress.Experience with at least one .NET CMS platformSkills in Visual Studio and PhotoShopFormal training in User Experience.Working experience with a non-profit organization.Familiarity with basic usability testing and QA processes.Experience with iMIS RiSE.Starting Salary:  *$55,231 annually*Salary based on location, Greater Toronto AreaDoes this sound like you? Then apply today! Send your cover letter and resume (as one file) to - HR@ girlguides.ca (remove spaces).This position will remain open until filled. Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis. Kindly reference the position title in the subject line of your email message Submissions without a cover letter will not be considered. GGC is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. We value a recruitment and selection process that is inclusive and barrier-free, and we encourage applications from people who are racialized,Indigenous, people from the 2SLGBTQI+ community, people with disabilities and other equity seeking groups.Upon request, GGC will make available reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities during the recruitment process. Accommodation requests should be made in advance to People & Culture at HR@ girlguides.ca (remove spaces).We thank all candidates for their interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 14 monthsSalary: From $55,231.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shift Show more

Position Information
Position Number P00181

Position Title Programmer/Analyst, Web Developer

Division/Portfolio IT Services

Department/Program Software & Support Services

Location Kelowna

Other Flexible Work Options

Your Opportunity
Under the direction of the Manager, IT Solutions, the Programmer/Analyst, Web Developer develops, tests, deploys, maintains and supports websites, integrations, web and mobile and software applications in support of Okanagan College business requirements.

Functions and Duties
1. Develops websites and web applications using modern CMS, web development languages and web application frameworks (e.g. Drupal, PHP, C#, .NET, HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Sass, AJAX, Bootstrap, Angular)
2. Develops and maintains dynamic, database-driven web applications and integrations to work within OC’s technology infrastructure
3. Creates applications and sites that are mobile responsive and meet accessibility, UI/UX design, and browser support standards
4. Collaborates with other IT Services personnel to provide operational and technical support for web, mobile, software, and enterprise applications. Assists the department and IT Services team in the resolution of technical customer issues
5. Collaborates with clients and technical staff on systems analysis tasks including requirements gathering, process, workflow, and data mapping, review of existing or proposed software systems, integrations and solutions
6. Creates documentation and assists with project work breakdown and implementation planning
7. Provides training, advice and assistance for departments developing and implementing their web pages
8. Recommends resource requirements, including hardware and software, necessary to support development and add functionality to the OC information infrastructure
9. Performs other duties as assigned

Education and Experience
University degree in the field of computer science, information systems, or software engineering, with a minimum of 2 years relevant work experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience and ability to use modern Web Development Frameworks, Javascript, CSS, HTML5, and general UI/UX principles is required. Experience with Drupal 8 or similar Content Management System would be an asset.

Skills and Abilities
Experience using modern CMS, web development languages and web application frameworks (e.g. Drupal, PHP, C#, .NET, HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Sass, AJAX, Bootstrap, Angular)Understanding of UI / UX, responsive design, web accessibility and web search principlesFamiliar with the use of full-stack development environments (e.g. Linux OS, Windows OS, Git, Jenkins, Docker, Apache, Tomcat, Nginx, IIS, AWS, Azure)Working knowledge of relational database concepts and SQL, can develop applications/integrations using APIs, web services, single sign-on and enterprise databases (e.g Oracle, PL/SQL, REST-based services, XML, JSON)Familiar with Software Development Life Cycle and Agile software development methodologiesApplies software development coding standards, data privacy, secure coding, and quality assurance best practicesAbility to communicate effectively with interdisciplinary teams, technical and non-technical staff at varying levels while exercising courtesy, professionalism, tact and discretionFlexible and adaptable with learning, understanding and applying new technologies, methodologies, tools and programming languagesStrong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Must be able to participate in meetings and group discussions, create formal and informal documentation as necessaryProven analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills, ability to investigate and assess software-related issues and productsHighly self-motivated and directedAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environmentAbility to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environmentKeen attention to detail and a quality driven mindset

Preferred Qualifications

Desired Start Date 09/05/2022

Position End Date (if temporary)

Schedule
On-Call position.

Annual Salary/Hourly Rate $29.64 - $33.90

Appointment Type Support - On Call

Special Instructions to Applicants
Shortlisted internal candidates must notify the current Support Staff Bargaining Chairperson and Human Resources if they want a union observer during interviews and final selection of candidates.

Job Posting Title
Junior Software Developer
Job Category
Systems Engineering
Language Requirements
English / Anglais
Posting Start Date
2022-08-15
Posting End Date
2022-08-27
Job Grade
CS-2
Pay Range
$81,635 - $99,208
Job Summary
Provide software programming support for real-time, mission- and safety-critical Air Traffic Management systems and related life-cycle management activities. Develop and maintain software programs and maintain the development system. Software development activities shall be in accordance with Corporate Safety and Quality policies and practices, and the Engineering Safety and Quality policies and practices.
Job Description
Key Accountabilities:
Provide system life-cycle support for Air Navigation operational and non-operational systems.
Assists in requirements analysis and specification writing and management.
Assists in the analysis, development, and implementation of software solutions for new requirements and identified deficiencies.
Assists in maintaining the software development environment.
Recommends practices for configuration, installation, optimization and use of productivity tools.
Education/Occupational Certification:
Degree from a recognized university or community college with an acceptable specialization in computer, electrical engineering, systems engineering, computer science or information systems, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
Up to 2 years experience in the following:
Software integration, software configuration management and software testing.
Test automation development, creation of unit tests
Developing backend and web-based applications using C/C++, Java, Python, JavaScript and HTML and/or developing customer-facing, front-end software through interaction with the customer.
Experience using Microsoft Office applications.
Web development experience with Django, Tomcat, and/or Apache would be an asset.
Experience using Google test, Junit and/or Robot Framework would be an asset.
Experience using modern C++ would be an asset.
Knowledge:
Knowledge of object-oriented analysis, design methodology and techniques.
Knowledge of traditional software development methodology and testing process and/or knowledge of Agile development methodology and Scrum process.
Knowledge of relational database design and development
Knowledge of Windows and/or Linux operating systems and configuration.
Knowledge of network principles and/or programming using TCP/IP, UDP, SNMP and multicast communication standards and protocols.
Knowledge of various software repository tools such as GitLab, Team Foundation Server, IBM Jazz.
Knowledge of container and container-orchestration systems, specifically Docker and Kubernetes would be an asset.
Knowledge of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS) middleware standard, and Webdev tech stack would be an asset.
Knowledge of Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) would be an asset.
Abilities:
Ability to analyse and solve problems.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
Personal Suitability:
Establish and maintain appropriate interpersonal relationship in dealings with team members and stakeholders.
Seek out new avenues for building internal and external relationships.
Shows initiative, integrity, reliability, good judgement positive attitude.
Resilient and openness to change.
As part of the PIPSC competitive process, you are required to fill out the Statement of Qualifications Application (SOQ) form. You can expect to receive it from the Talent Acquisition Advisor via e-mail and will be provided with 5 days to complete the form. If you do not complete the SOQ form within the prescribed timelines we will consider that you have withdrawn from the competition.*

We are looking for an individual who will flourish and grow within our company. Streampoint offers a high-energy environment where innovation and creativity is encouraged.Your Responsibilities will include:Working closely with a team of project managers, designers and developers to implement client business requirements for building event registration sitesCoding business logic through SQL stored procedures, functions and .NET custom controlsAdhoc data mining by writing custom database queriesParticipate in all phases of the development cycle, including planning, daily standups, demos and retrospectivesInterface with other technology teams to ensure issue-free deploymentsImplement best practices for testing, deploying, and developing codeTravelling onsite to events as technical support (if and when safe to do so)Additional developer duties as assigned by the Streampoint leadership team.Qualifications: Experience and understanding of ASP.NET web applications in C#Experience and understanding of relational databases using SQLExperience with Microsoft development stack: Visual Studio, Azure, SQL ServerProficiency in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScriptExperience with responsive designFamiliarity with browser testing and debuggingFamiliarity with REST APIs and web servicesUp to date with the latest design trends and patternsMust be able to travel by air and enter and exit the United States (without sponsorship) to attend event support when required and safe to do so.Additional Skills / PlusesCapable of handling heavy workload within established time framesAbility to adapt to frequent changes in workload and adjust quickly as circumstances dictateCan work independently and initiate with little directionStrong communication skills.Additional Information: Temporary work-from-home COVID-19 precautions:This position requires you to report and work from the Streampoint head office 2-3 times per week. Due to the evolving impact of COVID-19, our priority is ensuring that our team members are safe. About Mayk: Hey, Nice to Meet You! Glad you found us!We are Mayk Ideas - growth advisors and marketing creatives! Ingenuity without boundaries is at the heart of every strategy we envision and execute. We craft people-oriented, brand-building campaigns and business transformations that are intentional and value-driven. Our creative and venture acceleration services lead to measurable return on investment for the firms and brands we work with, as they are informed by data-driven strategies, good business sense, and meaningful connections. Our portfolio of clients include professional and financial services, sports and entertainment, technology, automotive and other B2B brands. Our clients are growing and so are we!You are: A forward focused Web Developer who is adept at collaborating with a diverse team of talented designers and strategists to build world-class brands, websites and campaigns for our clients. The right candidate is comfortable in a fast-paced interdisciplinary environment, has excellent communication skills, and is passionate about development and design.Reporting to the Creative Director and working with Client Services and Creative Services Team, you will dive into creating new and original designs based on the needs and specifications of our clients. This role can be based in the Kitchener-Waterloo region or remotely.What You’ll DoCreate:  Use project briefs, to collaborate with the team and create roadmaps to develop websites and support infrastructure. Develop sites that strike a balance between functional and aesthetic design. Work efficiently and iteratively to deliver value early and identify/communicate challenges that require input from other team members before they affect timelines/ deliverables.Deliver:  Work with the team to produce estimates, establish timeframes, and identify potential roadblocks/risks to successful delivery. Optimize sites for speed, usability, and accessibility across desktop, tablet and mobile platforms.Communicate:  Work constructively with team members across disciplines through roadblocks and challenges, solve problems and support the team while remaining porous to feedback. Consistently Test/QA your work throughout the development process.Your Superpowers: Given your background and work experience you are brave and delve into brand innovating designs. You have the ability and desire to thrive and excel in a fast paced, rapid growth environment.For the role you will have to be:· Committed and focused: Capacity to manage priorities and deadlines and exceptional attention to detail – you take pride in your work and sweat the small stuff· A collaborator:  The road to shared success combines the energy, ideas, and execution of many - architecting value and building lasting impact through teamwork.· A Communicator:  Working with other Maykers to deliver projects on time.Qualifications· University or College Degree (preferably in IT/ web development)· 3+ years' experience in front-end development preferably in an agency setting· Experience in WordPress, HTML / CSS/SCSS / JavaScript, PHP / TypeScript· Experience with web animation. CSS / JS / GASP / Canvas / etc.· Experience & understanding of security best practices· Experience managing workload in project management software (we use Wrike), and a demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with project managersExtras that will give you an edge· Great communication skills. You should be able to follow and present your decisions and processes clearly and confidently, regardless of audience.· Collaborative. You’re a great partner to other designers and your cross-functional teammates.· A growth mindset. You’re open and receptive to feedback, are low-ego, and can adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment.· Experience with Drupal, modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g. React/Next.js) , tooling (e.g. Webpack) and CI/CD· Experience with headless CMSs, Shopify, and basic server / DNS management skillsWhy you’ll love working here: Join us and help create a bright future for brands and businesses:· We are engaged, resourceful and we always find a way to support growth initiatives of companies through important milestones. Every member of the team has mental agility with the ability to juggle multiple projects/initiatives simultaneously.· We use communication and tech to level the playing field. Technology and data connect people and brands from all over, building thriving businesses with entrepreneurial partners.· We build campaigns and connections our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to help them not only grow their pieces of the pie – but enlarge the pie. And to do that these businesses need ideas, talent, brand and infrastructure.· We are curious and creative: We always find a way to get things done and come up with creative solutions to whatever problems are standing in our way. We lead with creativity in our decision-making and reason.We value candidates that bring a range of experience from different industries and a variety of creative influences. If you're special and can bring first-hand experience and empathy for the growth journey, tell us your story! Even if you don’t fit all the desired requirements.Let’s Get this Started!Please submit a cover letter, copy of your resume and/or a short video pitch. The link to your video (approx. 1-5 min) and/or your portfolio should be included in your resume or cover letter.Why are you the right person for Mayk? In the cover letter and/or video this is what we are expecting:· Two or three sentence summary about your academic and/or professional background.· Specific accomplishments from your background that explain how you fit with our candidate description above.· Tell us about a special project you worked on and what your biggest accomplishment was.· Do you wish to be considered for full-time permanent and/or contract employment?Please remember to submit your resume, link to your portfolio, cover letter/video pitch and include answers to the questions above. There is no word limit for your letter, but we’d prefer that you limit your answers to one page. Use the following format as the subject line for your submission "[Your Name] – [Role Title] Application".We look forward to meeting you!Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $55,000.00-$70,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental carePaid time offVision careSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's Degree (preferred)Experience:Front-end development: 3 years (preferred)Wordpress: 2 years (preferred) About Mayk: Hey, Nice to Meet You! We are looking for a new grad/ skilled Web programmer to join our team. Great opportunity to work at a Fortune 500 IT Consulting company, on a project for Ontario's largest energy company. This is a remote position that has a great chance of being extended long term.
Role Overview
Project: What you will be doing
Design and implement Web-based application using HTML, CSS, Javascript, Jquery , and ReactJS
Build and maintain scalable web applications using custom, reusable, and responsive UI components
Work closely with design teams and business owners to define, design, and implement features.
Evaluate, suggest, and outline improvements to existing interface flows

Skills Needed

Needs recent experience with ReactJS, GraphQL, AWS Amplify
Knowledge / experience required in HTML, CSS, jQuery, Typescript/ES6 needed
Page load optimizations and ability to write optimized JavaScript code
Experience with Google Map API
Knowledge of AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) preferred
Good experience in Bitbucket
Some Additional Things You Will Have:
Proven ability to meet deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Personable and able to work directly with customers and partners
