We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You'll Be Doing
You’ll be joining CIBC’s Alternate Solutions Group. You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale projects involving multiple back-end systems. As a Front-End Web Developer, you will build, implement and maintain easy, flexible, and personalized solutions that enhance the client experience.
How You'll Succeed
Analysis & Support: Evaluate requests to ensure stability and support of applications. Coordinate and/or execute implementation plans. Identify and resolve small to medium complex production problems. Monitor and analyze supported services and applications to identify opportunities for improvement and recommend solutions
Leadership Skills: Act as the application tech lead and run code-review sessions with the wider team to ensure the project is on track to meet objectives. Support and mentor intermediate and senior team members by sharing knowledge, collaborating and problem solving.
Act as a SME: Review requirements and provide feedback on problems and provide critical solutions and services in a timely and cost-effective manner. Provide estimates for assigned work packages and take the lead role in delivery. Ensure that expected application performance levels are achieved and SLAs are met.
Manage & Influence: Lead coordination efforts in operational activities to provide optimal end-to-end solutions for clients. Identify proactive solutions for recurring technology occurrences to benefit the business.
Strategy & Technology Design: Design, implement, configure, and manage solutions within the supported products, and services. Research and recommend innovative and automated approaches for operational tasks.
Design and Development: Perform and coordinate application activities. Design the application's technical infrastructure using specific databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions.
Strategic Planning: Lead multiple projects involving upgrade or migration of systems, new technology, and the enhancement of existing applications.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in: NodeJS, Angular, TypeScript, MongoDB, ELK, Kong, Swagger, REST API. It’s an asset if you have some experience with cloud technologies like AWS or Azure.
You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to build innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development
What you need to know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

Skills We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You'll Be Doing
You’ll be joining CIBC’s Alternate Solutions Group. You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale projects involving multiple back-end systems. As a Front-End Web Developer, you will build, implement and maintain easy, flexible, and personalized solutions that enhance the client experience.
How You'll Succeed
Analysis & Support: Evaluate requests to ensure stability and support of applications. Coordinate and/or execute implementation plans. Identify and resolve small to medium complex production problems. Monitor and analyze supported services and applications to identify opportunities for improvement and recommend solutions
Leadership Skills: Act as the application tech lead and run code-review sessions with the wider team to ensure the project is on track to meet objectives. Support and mentor intermediate and senior team members by sharing knowledge, collaborating and problem solving.
Act as a SME: Review requirements and provide feedback on problems and provide critical solutions and services in a timely and cost-effective manner. Provide estimates for assigned work packages and take the lead role in delivery. Ensure that expected application performance levels are achieved and SLAs are met.
Manage & Influence: Lead coordination efforts in operational activities to provide optimal end-to-end solutions for clients. Identify proactive solutions for recurring technology occurrences to benefit the business.
Strategy & Technology Design: Design, implement, configure, and manage solutions within the supported products, and services. Research and recommend innovative and automated approaches for operational tasks.
Design and Development: Perform and coordinate application activities. Design the application's technical infrastructure using specific databases, programming languages, utilities, and testing approaches. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions.
Strategic Planning: Lead multiple projects involving upgrade or migration of systems, new technology, and the enhancement of existing applications.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in: NodeJS, Angular, TypeScript, MongoDB, ELK, Kong, Swagger, REST API. It’s an asset if you have some experience with cloud technologies like AWS or Azure.
You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to build innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development
What you need to know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

About QubeQube Technologies is an Alberta start-up developing low-cost environmental surveillance technology. Our mission is to help primary industries, such as oil and gas, cost effectively detect, quantify, and reduce methane and other emissions. We are a well-funded and rapidly growing start-up that is well-positioned to help primary industries reduce their emissions footprint.Qube is seeking an experienced Frontend Developer to help ideate, develop, and commercialize our IoT analytics platform. Who we are:
Envisio is one of Western Canada's fastest-growing software companies. We are a mission-driven company passionate about creating deep, personalized relationships with our customers and supporting them in building trusted public institutions.
Envisio's award-winning software helps publicly funded, publicly accountable organizations in the US, Canada, and Australia to manage and execute plans, track and improve performance, and communicate results to their elected officials and other stakeholders.
We offer a competitive compensation package, employee stock options, and flexible working options. You can choose to work in our beautiful Downtown Vancouver office, via a hybrid model, or remotely from anywhere in Canada.
The opportunity:
We are looking for a talented, creative, and team-oriented Frontend Developer who has a desire to make modern and intuitive UI for our web-based applications. Your primary focus will be developing a new product module with other developers. You will be part of a team who is responsible for building a robust and rich front-end UI that our customers are using on a daily basis. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, elegant and extensible design, and quality products is imperative.
We expect the Front-end developer to
Report to the Software Development Manager
Write clean Javascript code
Build rich client-side applications using ReactJS
Handle client-server interactions using Apollo GraphQL
Style client-side applications using in-house existing UI libraries
It would be NICE if you have experience with (or are eager to learn):
UI design using Figma or similar tools
BEM and Atomic CSS
Ruby on Rails
Heroku PaaS setup and deployment
Your skills and experience:
Minimum 3 years of front end software development experience
Experience with several programming languages/frameworks such as Javascript, ReactJS and GraphQL
Past experience in applying technical knowledge and expertise to help the team overcome challenging or complex software problems
Experience in working with remote team members
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
What We Offer:
Extended healthcare coverage, including an HSA
20 days vacation
Gym membership benefit
Flexible work options (office, remote, or hybrid)
Stock options Who we are:

Join the EOS Nation team!EOS Nation builds solutions to maximize collaboration and independence for all humanity. We've been experimenting with the EOSIO blockchain community since 2018 and have developed unique Web3 skills and insights along with a robust portfolio of products, services, and infrastructure to propel us on this mission.Pomelo creates opportunities for individuals and teams to get funded by the community to build the public goods they care about. Through the magic of quadratic funding, our Web3 crowdfunding platform is on track to raise more than $2M for meaningful work that benefits the entire ecosystem – and we’re just getting started!We’re operators of the EOS, WAX, Ultra, UX, ORE, and BBS blockchains. We’re proud to be trusted delegates of some of the world’s largest DAOs and recognized leaders in high-performance and high-uptime bare metal infrastructure operations.We’re building Solutions to make the world’s open data accessible across blockchain protocols and communities. We operate independent data centers and participate with a community of global operators to ensure the critical data that makes Web3 experiences possible is available everywhere at all times.Your mission in our team…Put your Back end Developer skills to work. Join our team and help us build and maintain the infrastructure for innovative data solutions and financial instruments supporting the web3.0.We are looking for an analytical, results-driven back-end developer who will work with team members to troubleshoot and improve current back-end applications and processes. The Back-end Developer will use his or her understanding of programming languages and tools to analyze current codes and industry developments, formulate more efficient processes, solve problems, and create a more seamless experience for users.More precisely..You'll collaborate directly with EOS Nation's experienced team of blockchain engineers, product managers, and designers to deliver a great experience to users on the cutting edge of open data and decentralized finance.If you have: Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science.Experiences in Blockchain and Crypto or interest inProven work experience as a Back-end developer in GitHub;In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment);Hands on experience with programming languages like Go, C++, Javascript;Familiarity with Linux and front-end languages (e.g. HTML, JavaScript and CSS);Strong multitasking, troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills;Good time management skills, the ability to work independently.You have the following skills, or an interest in developing them: Containers on Linux (LXC, Docker);AWS S3 and EC2;SQL databases (MySQL/MariaDB, PostreSQL);NoSQL soutions identify new features;Follow emerging technologies.In return, we promise to give you: Insurance: Life Insurance,Dental Care,Long Term Disability,Extended Health Care (Drug plan, Vision, Healthcare Build groundbreaking digital products for a company with a clear mission — to help newcomers build their dream life in Canada.We are Moving2Canada, an organisation committed to simplifying the move to Canada for our community. We are seeking a Web Developer passionate about their craft and driven to help us connect with our global community. The position is open to candidates across Canada.Our work environment includes: Lively atmosphereFully remote workGrowth opportunitiesFlexible working hoursEmphasis on maintaining work/life balanceIn 2022, we are celebrating 10 successful years in business with a relaunch of our site. The new Moving2Canada will offer a dynamic, personalized user experience behind the login so that our community can understand and design their own journey to success in Canada, affordably and with confidence. This will be a disruptive product in an industry in need of disruption, and the hired candidate will be building and upgrading a wide set of features. React, PHP, and Javascript skills are a must.The hired candidate will be expected to integrate quickly and make a significant contribution to product development and website optimization.Primary responsibilities: Development of new features using React across three key appsTranslating designs to codeIntegration of React apps within WordPressData management using GraphQL, MySQLWebsite metric optimization across devicesStyling updates and bug fixes as neededThe hired candidate will lead a small development team, including a Junior Web Developer intern. We’re looking for someone who sees mentoring and leading as an asset and an opportunity.Qualifications: Minimum of 2 years experience with WordPress / PHPMinimum of 2 years experience with ReactStrong proficiency in CSS/SassStrong proficiency in JavaScriptFamiliarity with minifying CSS/JS, GulpExperience with ACF, Gravity Forms, TablePress a plusFamiliarity with Google Analytics, Ad Manager, and Search Console a plusFamiliarity with Salesforce a plusApplicants should include or link to a portfolio or examples of work with their application. Applications that do not include examples of work will not be considered.Your profile, our values: Moving2Canada is proud to be community minded. You are dedicated to understanding and serving our audience with all your passion. You are collaborative by nature and possess a willingness to be open minded and the courage to embrace everything new and different. Just like us, you are open to possibilities. When something does not go to plan, we are tenacious. We iterate and adapt to challenges. You are one of us, because you are focused on outcomes and goals and have the ability to prioritize your work independently. Moving2Canada is a mainly remote team and you appreciate the flexible way of working that comes with this perk.We are a progressive organization that takes great pride in maintaining a positive culture and strong work/life balance for all team members. We insist that you take time to take care of you.Please note that all applicants must be legally allowed to be employed in Canada. About ScrawlrScrawlr is a company building a software platform and series of products dedicated to enabling alternative forms of communication layered on existing internet content, together with delivering superior monetization flexibility and content ownership for content generators. We have recently completed our internal beta and are preparing for our external beta. We are looking forward to bringing on additional like-minded individuals to assist in product launch. The founder, board of directors, and lead investors in Scrawlr have a strong background in a variety of successful, transformational startups, and we are building our platform alongside a number of other startups within a successful ecosystem.Why you should work hereWe are working on a transformational project that we believe will have a global impact, and we expect our team members to work on solving complex, unique technical problems on a daily basis. Front-end team members are given a high degree of product ownership and the latitude to propose and implement approaches that can be divergent from all standard or existing solutions.Scrawlr is committed to maintaining an environment in which all ideas are taken seriously and great ideas are adopted, allowing dedicated employees to effect change and to dictate their progression within the organization.Compensation$72-89k per annum plus an options grant commensurate with capacity for contribution to the teamResponsibilitiesBuild frontend components and featuresConnect frontend with local storage and backend APIsDesired Skills & ExperienceThree (3) years of work experience in a development agency or company development environmentsStrong knowledge of core Javascript/HTML/CSSStrong understanding of cross-browser compatibility development and testing conceptsExperience working on Vue.js/React/Angular/etc frameworksExperience with web page performance, debugging, and best practicesExperience working with REST APIsExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsNice to have skills or experienceSolid experience with Javascript unit and feature testing concepts and frameworksExperience with module bundler systems and related web tooling conceptsPWA and Single Page Application project experienceChrome/Firefox extension development experienceExperience with Linux command line, and gitExperience working in start-up environmentsGitHub profile with sample projects you would like to showcaseIf you are interested in changing the way the world communicates, and then subsequently evaluates and monetizes content, we would love to speak with you. This position is a unique opportunity for an individual interested in launching a transformational product in a challenging, dynamic work environment.We are looking for exceptional individuals, and from there we can work with all levels of experience. If what we are doing is of interest to you, but you are not sure if you fit into this role, we look forward to engaging to find the right position.Please note: Candidates must be currently authorized to work in CanadaWe are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $72,000.00-$89,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayApplication question(s):If hired into a fully remote position, do you expect to be available during standard hours in pacific time (pst)? Zafin is the award-winning global leader in cloud-based product and pricing solutions. We enable clients to advance core banking modernization and their digital transformation roadmap. Zafin works with more than 450 financial institutions globally whose assets range in size from $200 million to $3 trillion in total assets.Zafin is backed by significant financial partners committed to accelerating the company’s growth and fueling our continued innovation. Our recent acquisition of FINCAD solidifies our position as a high-growth SaaS provider. Together, we are disrupting financial services by offering pricing and advanced analytics solutions to institutions across all banking segments: retail, corporate, commercial and capital markets.Our clients benefit from our 60 ecosystem partners and over 500 talented employees spread across 13 global offices. Zafin is proud to be recognized as a top employer and certified Great Place to Work® in Canada, UK and India.*What is the opportunity?*Reporting to the Director, Digital Strategy the Web Developer is responsible for building and maintaining a healthy ecosystem across all Zafin digital properties. This will include our WordPress site development including theme/template customization, CSS development, JavaScript, plugin customization, support with user journey mapping, UI performance optimization and general site maintenance. You will be working closely with our marketers and creative team to build and maintain our marketing websites, blog, customer portal, online knowledge base, forum, etc.*Location: * This role can be based anywhere in North America.What will you do?Manage operations and maintain all Zafin web properties in line with digital standards and best practices.Participate in strategy workshops to develop business, design, and technical briefs.Creation of WordPress custom themes (including custom post types, taxonomies, templates), admin customization, plugin installation and troubleshooting.WordPress front-end site development including theme/template customization, CSS development, JavaScript, plugin customization, and other UI & performance optimizationsHTML email and landing page template development for use in content management systems, marketing automation systems and email management toolsDelivering finished code that is clean, well-organized, and well documented.Execute testing strategies and validating all code to make sure it meets cross-browser, cross-platform, and cross-email app requirements.Providing timely resolution to reported problems with existing website.Collaborate with content creators, designers and internal stakeholders to achieve the best possible results in web projects from conception right through to delivery.Manage interactive online videos and games. Support measurement and reporting for organic and paid traffic, including SEO, SEM, Social and Display.What do you need to succeed?Must have: 6+ years of proven experience building advanced, interactive experiencesExtensive knowledge and understanding of cross-browser, responsive design principlesMastery of PHP/MySQL, HTML5/CSS3, JQuery and other Javascript frameworksAbility to evaluate plugins and tools but comfortable writing custom coded solutions, CSS and JSMeticulous in clear, clean code and ability to maintain concise change logs and technical document managementSolid understanding of server technologies and platformsVisual Composer, Marketo and PowerBIProven experience building advanced Wordpress sitesWhat's in it for you?If you work with us, we expect you’ll show the spirit, drive, and intellect that makes you great. We offer a challenging, team-oriented work environment, competitive remuneration and benefits, and excellent opportunities for professional and personal growth. Full Stack Developer (Remote, Canada EST)

Crowdlinker is an end-to-end digital product studio based in Toronto and Barcelona with a relentless focus on our customers. We connect people through technology by being the strongest link between companies, their ideas, and their clients. We do so by excelling at digital strategy, creative design, full-stack development of websites & web/mobile apps, and digital marketing (SEO, SEM, PPC, Marketing Automation).

As a Full-Stack Developer, you will be responsible for ensuring that user stories and features of projects are executed using sound development practices and the most up-to-date and reliable tools. You will collaborate with product managers and designers to ensure that the problem is being solved in the correct manner.

We are looking for someone to be a Full-Stack Ninja, and so your ability to code the front-end is critical and a strong understanding of the back-end is needed. We are looking for developers with an obsession for clean, well-structured coding practices who think about the sustainability of the products they build.


Responsibilities
Participate in technical design and planning discussions
Participate in brainstorming sessions with designers and product managers in prototype or wireframe stage
Work closely with our product managers to ensure projects are delivered in a timely fashion
Provide timely and accurate estimates for project deliverables
Hands-on troubleshooting, debugging and fixing of issues during development and post-release
Occasionally participate in and contribute to client meetings and proposals
Implement features based on user stories and project requirements
What you bring
Experience:
3+ years of web / mobile development experience
Proficient knowledge of at least one backend programming language like Node.js / PHP
Excellent understanding of at least one backend framework like Express, NestJS, or Laravel etc.
Experience working with SQL databases (PostgreSQL/MySQL) OR NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis, etc.)
Experience with implementing and consuming REST APIs
Proficient in using front-end frameworks such as React.js, React Native or Vue.js
Proficient with TypeScript, ES5/ES6, state management libraries like Redux / Context API, React Hooks, JSX and CSS-in-JS
Experience with designing application architectures and concepts like unit testing, TDD, and continuous integration
Strong understanding of project management tools such as Shortcut or JIRA
Experience working with Agile principles
Experience with Git for version control system such as GitHub
Proficient in writing maintainable CSS / SCSS with a strong understanding of Flexbox & experience working with responsive web design frameworks, such as Bootstrap / Zurb Foundation
Must haves:
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) and can clearly articulate your product decisions
Detail oriented, resourceful, creative, and strong logical and analytical skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously
Passionate about testing, quality, technology, and excellence
Team player mentality - comfortable collaborating and bouncing ideas off others
Experience with an iterative design and software development process: incorporating feedback, launching quickly, and testing hypotheses in an agile environment
Excellent organizational skills and ability to coordinate efforts and output according to the specifications of what is required
A sound understanding of design concepts and best practices required to build systems with considerations for scalability, performance, maintainability, testability, and extensibility


Nice to Haves:
Experience with GraphQL
Experience with testing libraries like Jest, Cypress, etc.
Experience with Docker
An overall understanding of popular frontend and backend languages, their associated frameworks and their upsides/downsides
Can mentor and coach other developers to skill up in their craft
Familiar with cloud providers, such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform and Digital Ocean
An impressive portfolio / GitHub handle to demonstrate skillsets

What’s in it for you?
Fully remote work environment with optional co-working spaces
5 weeks paid vacation
1 week extra Company wide shut down
Learn and implement the latest and greatest in product methodologies
Join an experienced team of developers, designers, business leaders, and digital marketers
A strong culture of excellence, mutual mentorship, and transparency
Competitive salary: $80,000 - $95,000 CAD
Flexible benefits package, including extended health care, dental, and a flex HSA
Potential for stock in the company


Duration of the role

This is a full-time, permanent role, not a contractor position.

How to apply

In your application, please include:

A link to your GitHub profile if you have one
A link to your LinkedIn profile if you have one
A link to your portfolio of work if you have one
A summary of how you would be able to make a difference on our team

You may include a traditional resume and cover letter as well, although it is not required.

Additional Information

Accommodations can be made upon request. Full Stack Developer (Remote, Canada EST)

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Front End Developer
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
As a Front End Developer within CM Digital team, you bring the ability to effectively provide development, support, and release activities on strategic initiatives to various business functions within RBC Capital Markets and RBC Investor & Treasury Services portfolio. This involves hands on coding, design and architect technical solutions, perform code reviews, research and adopt emerging technologies to keep product up to date. We are looking for a strong technical resource who can solution and execute to deliver front-end technical solutions leveraging ReactJS
What will you do?
Helps drive architectural discussions, enforces code structure, code quality, patterns and standards and oversees the execution / production of product development. Uses domain knowledge to mitigate tactical and technological risks
Works with Business Owners, Project Managers to ensure that the deliverables achieve the business result that enables value creation.
Recommend system solutions by comparing advantages and disadvantages of different approaches; provide accurate cost estimates and work with the team to meet the projected timelines
Ensures user experience, and user interface design is cutting edge, user friendly, and intuitive. Partners up with UI/UX leads where appropriate
Helps to drive product adoption, including demos, planning product features and changes during the early stages of project formation
Building exciting, customer-focused, engaging applications by focusing on software engineering / design / architecture excellence
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
5+ years development experience with JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Redux, RxJS, Node.js, etc. used to build scalable server-side APIs and modern applications
Solid hands on experience using HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3 - good understanding of responsive layouts, mobile-first design, etc.
Hands on experience designing, developing, testing and troubleshooting RESTful API and interface specifications (Swagger)
Experience with DevOps such as Git, Jenkins, Jira, Confluence and other similar technologies
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent Communications skills - ability to present effectively to peers and management as it relates to technical solutions
Nice-to-have
Experience with Test-Driven-Design - Unit-Testing and Functional Testing, using frameworks like Jest, Mocha, Chai and MSW
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Title
Front End Developer
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
As a Front End Developer within CM Digital team, you bring the ability to effectively provide development, support, and release activities on strategic initiatives to various business functions within RBC Capital Markets and RBC Investor & Treasury Services portfolio. This involves hands on coding, design and architect technical solutions, perform code reviews, research and adopt emerging technologies to keep product up to date. We are looking for a strong technical resource who can solution and execute to deliver front-end technical solutions leveraging ReactJS
What will you do?
Helps drive architectural discussions, enforces code structure, code quality, patterns and standards and oversees the execution / production of product development. Uses domain knowledge to mitigate tactical and technological risks
Works with Business Owners, Project Managers to ensure that the deliverables achieve the business result that enables value creation.
Recommend system solutions by comparing advantages and disadvantages of different approaches; provide accurate cost estimates and work with the team to meet the projected timelines
Ensures user experience, and user interface design is cutting edge, user friendly, and intuitive. Partners up with UI/UX leads where appropriate
Helps to drive product adoption, including demos, planning product features and changes during the early stages of project formation
Building exciting, customer-focused, engaging applications by focusing on software engineering / design / architecture excellence
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
5+ years development experience with JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Redux, RxJS, Node.js, etc. used to build scalable server-side APIs and modern applications
Solid hands on experience using HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3 - good understanding of responsive layouts, mobile-first design, etc.
Hands on experience designing, developing, testing and troubleshooting RESTful API and interface specifications (Swagger)
Experience with DevOps such as Git, Jenkins, Jira, Confluence and other similar technologies
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent Communications skills - ability to present effectively to peers and management as it relates to technical solutions
Nice-to-have
Experience with Test-Driven-Design - Unit-Testing and Functional Testing, using frameworks like Jest, Mocha, Chai and MSW
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Front-End Developer (Remote)*We Are Creative Commerce Experts*Our team is driven by a single purpose – to create stunning e-commerce experiences for our customers. We are creative thinkers with a keen eye for detail and a knack for creating innovative solutions to complex problems. We are looking to expand our team with a creative thinker who takes pride in creating rock solid code and strives to maintain a cutting edge in an ever changing industry.*Job Summary*As a Front-End Developer at Pointer, you are responsible for collaborating with our world class design team to turn high fidelity mockups into stunning Shopify experiences for our clients. The expectations of a front-end developer at Pointer are very high and we are looking for someone that shares our dedication in producing the highest quality work. An advanced understanding of modern web animation technologies and javascript knowledge will be essential for a successful candidate.*Responsibilities*- Build out design comps to pixel perfect accuracy- Ability to write structured, well-organized, and reusable code- Inspect and troubleshoot bugs and other QA issues- Stay up to date with best practices, trends, and tools.*Core Competencies*- Initiative: Continuous learning by keeping up with best practices in modern web development.- Attention to Detail: Ensure that the design for the project is followed and functional.- Collaboration: Work alongside the design team to ensure our clients are getting the best possible outcome.- Time Management: Respect assigned time parameters so as not to delay project presentation.- Communication: Effectively communicate with the rest of the team to ensure a predictable project from start to finish.*Essential Skills*- 4 years experience in web development or equivalent combination of education and experience- An advanced understanding of modern web animation technologies and javascript knowledge- Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS/SCSS- Experience building mobile-first website in a responsive framework- Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment- Excellent verbal and written communication skills- Experience collaborating with a design team to build out mockups- Extremely strong attention to detail- Previous experience using version-control tools such as Git- Experience using the Shopify platform to preferred but not necessary- Experiencing consuming RESTful API’s*Preferred Skills*- WebGl- Liquid- GraphQL- Javascript frameworks such as React, React Native, Vue, etc.Why work here?We're an award winning, dynamic and growing agency built on strong values. We focus on collaboration, creativity and the customer experience. We are committed to cultivating an inclusive team and want to expand our hiring of the non-binary, BIPOC and LGBTQ+ communities. So however you identify and whatever your background is, if you share our values, we want to hear from you!Our goal is provide a flexible work life balance by offering both fully remote, and hybrid options tailored to your unique situation and your location. We are an Ottawa based company that has office space available if you are located in the capital region.Pointer offers a flexible time off policy, with paid vacation & sick days. We have a comprehensive group benefit plan, that can include extended health and dental coverage.Oh and we've got great swag to deck you out from head to ankle.If you are a creative thinker, a resourceful problem solver, and never one to shy away from a challenge, then we want to hear from you!Job Type: Full-time Front-End Developer (Remote)*We Are Creative Commerce Experts*Our team is driven by a single purpose – to create stunning e-commerce experiences for our customers. We are creative thinkers with a keen eye for detail and a knack for creating innovative solutions to complex problems. Have a passion for software? Join a world leader and make a difference! Transoft is making an enormous difference to the transportation planning and design community. With offices around the world, Transoft Solutions is an international leader in the development of innovative software for the civil/transportation engineering profession. This year the company celebrates its 30th year and we are proud of the extent of our user footprint – over 50,000 users in 150 countries worldwide. The company’s success is a result of our amazing work culture, our innovative and highly sought-after products, and the superb customer service we deliver.
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Software Developer, Web Services at our head office in Richmond, BC. Under the general direction of the Director, DevOps, and in close collaboration with a cross functional team, the Software Developer, Web Services is responsible for receiving and analyzing task requests and assisting with the development, maintenance and operation of web-based applications and components including CRM.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Receive and analyze requests related to web services development from internal and external stakeholders.
Record, track, and estimate tasks with the help of the Web and CRM team.
Execute projects using Transoft’s software development processes.
Drive, design, develop, deploy and maintain our SaaS software products.
Drive, design, develop, deploy and maintain our CRM system, customizations and supporting services.
Provide technical CRM support for users.
Work with team members and Development to upkeep all web related information, technology and software.
Assist team members in troubleshooting and resolving problems related to our website, applications and all other web components.
Assist with Technical Support when required.


BENEFITS and PERKS

Flexible work arrangements (Work from home / hybrid options, flexible work hours)
RRSP matching
Extended health, dental, vision benefits
Annual performance-based bonuses
Outstanding achievement recognition programs
Charitable donation matching
Educational assistance and training opportunities
Company and team building events (Barbeques, potlucks, holiday events, monthly socials – you name it!)


ABOUT YOU

You are a motivated developer, driven to produce high quality solutions that support our global teams. You understand the principles of agile software development and can produce features efficiently in a fast-paced work environment. You excel at designing and implementing new features and systems but understand the importance of maintaining existing systems. You want to work and grow with a group of dedicated software professionals and get on board with a fast growing, leading edge, and competitive software company.
SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Self-motivated and driven to be successful in the workplace and in life.
Able to track, estimate, prioritize and implement many tasks in parallel with multiple different requestors
Possess strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively, respectfully, and tactfully.
Excellent problem-solving skills to identify issues and solve them tactfully.
Possess analytical skills to gather and review information.
Good interpersonal skills.
Interested in keeping up to date with web technology.
Must be able to work evenings and/or weekends as needed, to provide scheduled maintenance or emergency repairs (to minimize disruptions during business hours).


EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:

A minimum bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related fields.
Expertise developing web-based applications using:
C#, WCF, ASP.NET, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery
MSSQL, MySQL, JSON and/or Mongo DB
Experience with other Web development technologies such as Node.js, PHP, Silverlight, Google API, etc.
Experience with Ecommerce, shopping cart and payment systems
CMS sites such as WordPress, Drupal and/or Joomla
Working knowledge of OO principles, UML diagrams, UI design and software life cycle tools.
Experience working in an agile environment.

ABOUT US
Since 1991, Transoft Solutions has developed advanced and highly specialized software solutions for aviation, civil infrastructure, transportation, and operational professionals. Our portfolio of planning, simulation, modeling, design, and road safety analysis solutions is used every day by thousands of organizations in over 150 countries worldwide. Clients include government agencies at the federal, state, county, and municipal levels, as well as major international airports and top engineering and architectural design firms. But we’re not just in the business of developing engineering software; we also believe in delivering outstanding sales and technical services.


We believe in teamwork, personal growth, superb customer service and continuous improvement. We like to celebrate our successes, our milestones, and our diversity. Transoft stands behind three building blocks for success: our Customers, our Products, and our People; and culture is a very integral part of our existence. We take every opportunity to enjoy and share the benefits of having large company ambitions and small company agility. We are engineers and developers, account managers and marketers, accountants, and administrators. Yes, we might be professional nerds, but after getting to know us, you’ll find that we are passionate, curious, generous, competitive and friendly. We work hard together to exceed our customers’ expectations. We also believe that it is important to leave this world in a better place and we strive to give back to our communities. Transoft is a diverse group, and we all benefit from the unique ideas, experiences and talents that make-up Transoft. We know that are greatest resource is the diversity of our people


WHY JOIN US?
We offer an attractive and competitive compensation package including pay-for-performance incentives, professional development opportunities, RRSP matching, comprehensive group health benefits, family friendly policies, and flexible work options. Hybrid work options are available for this job. If you’re bright, creative, resourceful, and want to make a real difference rather than just be another ‘cog on the wheel’, join our team and start on a journey you won’t regret!
Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Have a passion for software? Join a world leader and make a difference! Transoft is making an enormous difference to the transportation planning and design community. With offices around the world, Transoft Solutions is an international leader in the development of innovative software for the civil/transportation engineering profession. This year the company celebrates its 30th year and we are proud of the extent of our user footprint – over 50,000 users in 150 countries worldwide. The company’s success is a result of our amazing work culture, our innovative and highly sought-after products, and the superb customer service we deliver.
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Software Developer, Web Services at our head office in Richmond, BC. Under the general direction of the Director, DevOps, and in close collaboration with a cross functional team, the Software Developer, Web Services is responsible for receiving and analyzing task requests and assisting with the development, maintenance and operation of web-based applications and components including CRM.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Receive and analyze requests related to web services development from internal and external stakeholders.
Record, track, and estimate tasks with the help of the Web and CRM team.
Execute projects using Transoft’s software development processes.
Drive, design, develop, deploy and maintain our SaaS software products.
Drive, design, develop, deploy and maintain our CRM system, customizations and supporting services.
Provide technical CRM support for users.
Work with team members and Development to upkeep all web related information, technology and software.
Assist team members in troubleshooting and resolving problems related to our website, applications and all other web components.
Assist with Technical Support when required.


BENEFITS and PERKS

Flexible work arrangements (Work from home / hybrid options, flexible work hours)
RRSP matching
Extended health, dental, vision benefits
Annual performance-based bonuses
Outstanding achievement recognition programs
Charitable donation matching
Educational assistance and training opportunities
Company and team building events (Barbeques, potlucks, holiday events, monthly socials – you name it!)


ABOUT YOU

You are a motivated developer, driven to produce high quality solutions that support our global teams. You understand the principles of agile software development and can produce features efficiently in a fast-paced work environment. You excel at designing and implementing new features and systems but understand the importance of maintaining existing systems. You want to work and grow with a group of dedicated software professionals and get on board with a fast growing, leading edge, and competitive software company.
SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Self-motivated and driven to be successful in the workplace and in life.
Able to track, estimate, prioritize and implement many tasks in parallel with multiple different requestors
Possess strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively, respectfully, and tactfully.
Excellent problem-solving skills to identify issues and solve them tactfully.
Possess analytical skills to gather and review information.
Good interpersonal skills.
Interested in keeping up to date with web technology.
Must be able to work evenings and/or weekends as needed, to provide scheduled maintenance or emergency repairs (to minimize disruptions during business hours).


EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:

A minimum bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related fields.
Expertise developing web-based applications using:
C#, WCF, ASP.NET, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery
MSSQL, MySQL, JSON and/or Mongo DB
Experience with other Web development technologies such as Node.js, PHP, Silverlight, Google API, etc.
Experience with Ecommerce, shopping cart and payment systems
CMS sites such as WordPress, Drupal and/or Joomla
Working knowledge of OO principles, UML diagrams, UI design and software life cycle tools.
Experience working in an agile environment.

Job Description
Weir Motion Metrics
Vancouver, BC (Canada)
Weir Motion Metrics is a Canadian mining technology division that enables a new generation of safe, smart, and sustainable mining. Based in Vancouver, B.C., the company joined forces with Weir, one of the world’s leading engineering businesses, to empower mines by developing and deploying advanced monitoring solutions that address the industry’s toughest challenges.
A diverse and tight-knit team of 100+ engineers, scientists, and professionals, Weir Motion Metrics colleagues share a passion for driving industry change through innovation by leveraging leading-edge, rugged camera technology and artificial intelligence. Through deep collaboration and industry expertise, Weir Motion Metrics prioritizes customer partnerships in productivity and safety. Serving the mining market since 1999, then joining Weir in 2021, Motion Metrics is proud to be Weir’s first-ever center of excellence for artificial intelligence and machine vision technology.
We are looking for a Frontend Developer to join our expanding Cloud Development team.
Key responsibilities:
Define, review, estimate, and execute projects related to front-end software development.
Design software architectural models and libraries for software applications that satisfy all front-end project requirements.
Utilize both on-premise and cloud technologies to implement and deploy solutions.
Ensure that all code and designs are carefully documented and shared with other team members.
Ensure that front-end software applications meet industry standard security practices.
Create tests, documentation, processes, and tools for ensuring deployment to production environment is successful.
Research new technology trends and standards to see if they can be applied.
Requirements:
At least 3 years of experience with developing front end web application
Proficient in react, javascript, chart.js, typescript, websocket, restful API, trouble shooting and optimization
Experience with Vue, Vutify, three.js
We take pride in providing a quality workplace and promoting equal opportunities for all.
For additional information about Weir Motion Metrics, visit us at www.motionmetrics.com

Have a passion for software? Join a world leader and make a difference! Transoft is making an enormous difference to the transportation planning and design community. With offices around the world, Transoft Solutions is an international leader in the development of innovative software for the civil/transportation engineering profession. This year the company celebrates its 31st year and we are proud of the extent of our user footprint – over 50,000 users in 150 countries worldwide. The company’s success is a result of our amazing work culture, our innovative and highly sought-after products, and the superb customer service we deliver.
Transoft Solution’s Transportation Safety Unit is the leader in cutting-edge traffic safety analytics. We analyze traffic patterns – applying computer vision, AI, and machine learning to measure collision risk and predict incidents before they take place. We are growing our team to transform the world and build tomorrow’s cities – today! Since 1991, Transoft Solutions has invested in people, software, and technology to help our clients achieve their full potential.
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY
The Web Developer works with the technical team to design and implement features in Transoft's Web based software portfolio. This will include features for our AI-driven Traffic Safety and Intelligent Transportation System products as well as features for our customer portal and related systems.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Invent new software solutions to solve software engineering design problems.
Develop, Maintain, improve and re-invent existing company products.
Work closely with product management to gather software requirements.
Work with project team to plan, analyze and estimate project timelines.
Assist customer support, sales and marketing departments.
Contribute to continuous improvements within the agile software development process.
Collaborate with other stakeholders and be accountable to each other to achieve the project’s vision.


BENEFITS and PERKS

Flexible work arrangements (Work from home / hybrid options, flexible work hours)
RRSP matching
Extended health, dental, vision benefits
Annual performance-based bonuses
Outstanding achievement recognition programs
Charitable donation matching
Educational assistance and training opportunities
Company and team building events (Barbeques, potlucks, holiday events – you name it!)


ABOUT YOU
You are a motivated full-stack developer, driven to produce high quality solutions that support our global teams. You understand the principles of agile software development and can produce features efficiently in a fast-paced work environment. You excel at designing and implementing new features and systems but understand the importance of maintaining existing systems. You want to work and grow with a group of dedicated software professionals and get on board with a fast growing, leading edge, and competitive software company.
SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:

Full-stack developer comfortable working with users to develop features in our products including innovative new tools to solve engineering problems. (Including requirements analysis, software design and implementation, algorithm development and user interface).
Work well in a deadline-driven agile software development environment.
Working knowledge of UI and UX design, database schemas, and software life cycle tools.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Communicate well with product management team members and other stakeholders with diverse background.
Self-motivated and driven to be successful.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, engineering, or related fields.
2 to 3 years of experience using Node.js/React or Ruby/Rails
Should have experience on database technologies like SQL server and/or PostrgreSQL.
2 to 3 years of experience in UI technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
A prior experience in D3.js, Three.js, or similar data visualization libraries is an asset.
Experience in product-based development environment is desirable.


ABOUT US
Since 1991, Transoft Solutions has developed advanced and highly specialized software solutions for aviation, civil infrastructure, transportation, and operational professionals. Our portfolio of planning, simulation, modeling, design, and road safety analysis solutions is used every day by thousands of organizations in over 150 countries worldwide. Clients include government agencies at the federal, state, county, and municipal levels, as well as major international airports and top engineering and architectural design firms. But we’re not just in the business of developing engineering software; we also believe in delivering outstanding sales and technical services.


We believe in teamwork, personal growth, superb customer service and continuous improvement. We like to celebrate our successes, our milestones, and our diversity. Transoft stands behind three building blocks for success: our Customers, our Products, and our People; and culture is a very integral part of our existence. We take every opportunity to enjoy and share the benefits of having large company ambitions and small company agility. We are engineers and developers, account managers and marketers, accountants, and administrators. Yes, we might be professional nerds, but after getting to know us, you’ll find that we are passionate, curious, generous, competitive and friendly. We work hard together to exceed our customers’ expectations. We also believe that it is important to leave this world in a better place and we strive to give back to our communities. Transoft is a diverse group, and we all benefit from the unique ideas, experiences and talents that make-up Transoft. We know that are greatest resource is the diversity of our people


WHY JOIN US?
We offer an attractive and competitive compensation package including pay-for-performance incentives, professional development opportunities, RRSP matching, comprehensive group health benefits, family friendly policies, and flexible work options. Hybrid work options are available for this job. If you’re bright, creative, resourceful, and want to make a real difference rather than just be another ‘cog on the wheel’, join our team and start on a journey you won’t regret!
Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Have a passion for software? Address:
120 Bloor Street East
Job Family Group:
Technology
#BMOBranchTechnology
BMO is looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Developer with extensive Angular development experience that can help deliver consistent, testable and scalable solutions and innovative experiences for our customers. You will work in an agile environment designing, building and testing with our business partners and our quality assurance team.
Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, API Management, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy.
Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems.
Responsibilities:
Work with UI/UX designers to ensure technical feasibility of their designs
Develop new user-facing responsive features
Provided material feedback & mentorship to Junior Developers
Helps to establish/maintain coding and development standards for their teams
Provide direction and collaborate with back-end developers to produce integrated solutions
Optimize front end applications for maximum speed & performance
Build reusable code and libraries for future use and follow emerging technologies
Create quality mock-ups and prototypes for testing
Supports research and development of development frameworks, and definition of standards.
Implements and supports initiatives as required to deliver business objectives.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
Monitors and tracks performance and address any issues.
Reviews the work of other team members as required.
Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs.
Decomposes business requirements and translates them into detailed design specifications and code.
Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers.
Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs.
Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery.
Supports production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis.
Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns.
Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.
Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.
Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes.
Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Technical Skills:
Typically between 3 - 5 years of relevant experience and/or certification in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Deep expertise in modern JavaScript / TypeScript / to name a few
Angular, Lifecycle & CLI
Security best-practices
Frontend Performance and Bundle Budgeting
Mobile Web, Hybrid applications and PWAs – Nice to have
Clean code
Test-driven development & experience with Jest
Refactoring expertise
Advanced Git usage
Agile project experience & delivery
Ionic Framework experience is a plus
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes. Address:

Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers.
Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs.
Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery.
Supports production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis.
Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns.
Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.
Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.
Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes.
Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Technical Skills:
Typically between 3 - 5 years of relevant experience and/or certification in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Deep expertise in modern JavaScript / TypeScript / to name a few
Angular, Lifecycle & CLI
Security best-practices
Frontend Performance and Bundle Budgeting
Mobile Web, Hybrid applications and PWAs – Nice to have
Clean code
Test-driven development & experience with Jest
Refactoring expertise
Advanced Git usage
Agile project experience & delivery
Ionic Framework experience is a plus
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes. Address:
120 Bloor Street East

BMO is looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Developer with extensive Angular development experience that can help deliver consistent, testable and scalable solutions and innovative experiences for our customers. You will work in an agile environment designing, building and testing with our business partners and our quality assurance team.
Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, API Management, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy.
Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems.

Work with UI/UX designers to ensure technical feasibility of their designs
Develop new user-facing responsive features
Provided material feedback & mentorship to Junior Developers
Helps to establish/maintain coding and development standards for their teams
Provide direction and collaborate with back-end developers to produce integrated solutions
Optimize front end applications for maximum speed & performance
Build reusable code and libraries for future use and follow emerging technologies
Create quality mock-ups and prototypes for testing
Supports research and development of development frameworks, and definition of standards.
Implements and supports initiatives as required to deliver business objectives.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
Monitors and tracks performance and address any issues.
Reviews the work of other team members as required.
